com.linecorp.armeria.common

Class ServiceInvocationContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.netty.util.DefaultAttributeMap
      • com.linecorp.armeria.common.ServiceInvocationContext
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AttributeMap

    public abstract class ServiceInvocationContext
extends DefaultAttributeMap
    Provides information about an invocation and related utilities. Every remote invocation, regardless of if it's client side or server side, has its own ServiceInvocationContext instance.

    • Constructor Summary

      Creates a new instance.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ServiceInvocationContext

        protected ServiceInvocationContext(Channel ch,
                                   Scheme scheme,
                                   String host,
                                   String path,
                                   String mappedPath,
                                   String loggerName,
                                   Object originalRequest)
        Creates a new instance.
        Parameters:
        ch - the Channel that handles the invocation
        scheme - the Scheme of the invocation
        host - the host part of the invocation, as defined in the section 14.23 of RFC2616
        path - the absolute path part of the invocation, as defined in the section 5.1.2 of RFC2616
        mappedPath - the path with its context path removed. Same with path if client side.
        loggerName - the name of the Logger which is returned by logger()
        originalRequest - the session-level protocol message which triggered the invocation e.g. FullHttpRequest

    • Method Detail

      • current

        public static ServiceInvocationContext current()
        Returns the context of the invocation that is being handled in the current thread.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the context is unavailable in the current thread

      • mapCurrent

        public static <T> T mapCurrent(Function<? super ServiceInvocationContext,T> mapper,
                               @Nullable
                               Supplier<T> defaultValueSupplier)
        Maps the context of the invocation that is being handled in the current thread.
        Parameters:
        mapper - the Function that maps the invocation
        defaultValueSupplier - the Supplier that provides the value when the context is unavailable in the current thread. If null, the null will be returned when the context is unavailable in the current thread.

      • setCurrent

        public static void setCurrent(ServiceInvocationContext ctx)
        (Do not use; internal use only) Set the invocation context of the current thread.

      • removeCurrent

        public static void removeCurrent()
        (Do not use; internal use only) Removes the invocation context from the current thread.

      • eventLoop

        public final EventLoop eventLoop()
        Returns the EventLoop that is handling this invocation.

      • contextAwareEventLoop

        public final EventLoop contextAwareEventLoop()
        Returns an EventLoop that will make sure this invocation is set as the current invocation before executing any callback. This should almost always be used for executing asynchronous callbacks in service code to make sure features that require the invocation context work properly. Most asynchronous libraries like CompletableFuture provide methods that accept an Executor to run callbacks on.

      • makeContextAware

        public final Executor makeContextAware(Executor executor)
        Returns an Executor that will execute callbacks in the given executor, making sure to propagate the current invocation context into the callback execution. It is generally preferred to use contextAwareEventLoop() to ensure the callback stays on the same thread as well.

      • makeContextAware

        public final <T> Callable<T> makeContextAware(Callable<T> callable)
        Returns a Callable that makes sure the current invocation context is set and then invokes the input callable.

      • makeContextAware

        public final Runnable makeContextAware(Runnable runnable)
        Returns a Runnable that makes sure the current invocation context is set and then invokes the input runnable.

      • makeContextAware

        public final <T> FutureListener<T> makeContextAware(FutureListener<T> listener)
        Returns a FutureListener that makes sure the current invocation context is set and then invokes the input listener.

      • makeContextAware

        public final ChannelFutureListener makeContextAware(ChannelFutureListener listener)
        Returns a ChannelFutureListener that makes sure the current invocation context is set and then invokes the input listener.

      • onEnter

        public ServiceInvocationContext onEnter(Runnable callback)
        Registers callback to be run when re-entering this ServiceInvocationContext, usually when using the makeContextAware(java.util.concurrent.Executor) family of methods. Any thread-local state associated with this context should be restored by this callback.

      • onExit

        public ServiceInvocationContext onExit(Runnable callback)
        Registers callback to be run when re-exiting this ServiceInvocationContext, usually when using the makeContextAware(java.util.concurrent.Executor) family of methods. Any thread-local state associated with this context should be reset by this callback.

      • alloc

        public final ByteBufAllocator alloc()
        Returns the ByteBufAllocator used by the connection that is handling this invocation. Use this ByteBufAllocator when allocating a new ByteBuf, so that the same pool is used for buffer allocation and thus the pool is utilized fully.

      • logger

        public final org.slf4j.Logger logger()
        Returns the Logger which logs information about this invocation as the prefix of log messages. e.g. If a user called ctx.logger().info("Hello"), 
        
 [id: 0x270781f4, /127.0.0.1:63466 => /127.0.0.1:63432][tbinary+h2c://example.com/path#method][42] Hello

      • scheme

        public final Scheme scheme()
        Returns the Scheme of this invocation.

      • host

        public final String host()
        Returns the host part of this invocation, as defined in the section 14.23 of RFC2616. e.g. "example.com" and not "example.com:8080"
        See Also:
        URI.getHost()

      • path

        public final String path()
        Returns the absolute path part of this invocation, as defined in the section 5.1.2 of RFC2616.

      • mappedPath

        public final String mappedPath()
        Returns the path with its context path removed. This method can be useful for a reusable service bound at various path prefixes. For client side invocations, this method always returns the same value as path().

      • remoteAddress

        public final SocketAddress remoteAddress()
        Returns the remote address of this invocation.

      • localAddress

        public final SocketAddress localAddress()
        Returns the local address of this invocation.

      • invocationId

        public abstract String invocationId()
        Returns the ID of this invocation. Note that the ID returned by this method is only for debugging purposes and thus is never guaranteed to be unique.

      • method

        public abstract String method()
        Returns the method name of this invocation.

      • paramTypes

        public abstract List<Class<?>> paramTypes()
        Returns the parameter types of this invocation. Note that this is potentially an expensive operation.

      • returnType

        public abstract Class<?> returnType()
        Returns the return type of this invocation.

      • params

        public abstract List<Object> params()
        Returns the parameters of this invocation.

      • originalRequest

        public <T> T originalRequest()
        Returns the session-level protocol message which triggered this invocation. e.g. FullHttpRequest

      • resolvePromise

        public void resolvePromise(Promise<?> promise,
                           Object result)
        Resolves the specified promise with the specified result so that the promise is marked as 'done'. If promise is done already, this method does the following:
        • Log a warning about the failure, and
        • Release result if it is a reference-counted object, such as ByteBuf and FullHttpResponse.
        Note that a Promise can be done already even if you did not call this method in the following cases:
        • Invocation timeout - The invocation associated with the Promise has been timed out.
        • User error - A service implementation called any of the following methods more than once:
          • resolvePromise(Promise, Object)
          • rejectPromise(Promise, Throwable)
          • Promise.setSuccess(Object)
          • Promise.setFailure(Throwable)
          • Future.cancel(boolean)

      • rejectPromise

        public void rejectPromise(Promise<?> promise,
                          Throwable cause)
        Rejects the specified promise with the specified cause. If promise is done already, this method logs a warning about the failure. Note that a Promise can be done already even if you did not call this method in the following cases:
        • Invocation timeout - The invocation associated with the Promise has been timed out.
        • User error - A service implementation called any of the following methods more than once:
          • resolvePromise(Promise, Object)
          • rejectPromise(Promise, Throwable)
          • Promise.setSuccess(Object)
          • Promise.setFailure(Throwable)
          • Future.cancel(boolean)

      • toString

        public final String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
